question: 解く
sourceAnswer: to{} untie/unfasten/unwrap/undo/unbind/unpack | unsew/unstitch | solve/work-out/answer | dispel-(misunderstanding,-etc.)/clear-up/remove-(suspicion)/appease | dissolve-(a-contract)/cancel/remove-(a-prohibition)/lift-(a-ban)/raise-(a-siege) | release-(from-duty)/relieve/dismiss | comb-(out)/card/untangle-(hair)
userAnswer: to{} un-{ravel/tie/stitch} | solve | dissolve | clear-up | release | comb ...
activeAnswer: to{} un-{ravel/tie/stitch} | solve | dissolve | clear-up | release | comb ...
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>solve</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to solve</vocabulary>. You know this verb is for when you are doing the solving because you think it's super <reading>coo</reading>' (<ja>く</ja>) to solve things.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as <ja>解ける</ja>, so if you know that you can read this one too.
